title: Setting up the equation
text: Set up the equation by setting the speed of Dana's walking to $$r$$.

title: Relating the Numbers
text: We know that distance $$=$$ $$rate time$$ since we are told two different distances and rates have related time, we can set these two expressions such that $$\frac{distance1}{rate1}$$ + $$\frac{distance2}{rate2}$$ $$=$$ $$2.5$$.

title: Setting up the equation
text: What is the relationship between the two distances and rates?

title: Double-Checking
text: Double check that the answer makes sense in terms of the context of the question.
